meanings.definition: An ancient Roman coin worth one quarter of a denarius.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, a sesterce could buy bread and olives.
meanings.sent2: He found an old sesterce while digging in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The sesterce rolled under the couch and became a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as a sesterce in modern times.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the sesterce caught his eye in the dirt.

meanings.definition: A sum of money equal to one sesterce.
meanings.sent1: She owed him a sesterce for the borrowed book.
meanings.sent2: The street performer earned a sesterce for his entertaining act.
meanings.sent3: Finding a sesterce in his pocket, he felt like a lucky man.
meanings.sent4: Her words were worth more than a sesterce to him.
meanings.sent5: The sesterce jingled in his hand, a small fortune in itself.
